fin-1.chunk: Employees may claim travel expenses for approved trips.

fin-2.chunk: Airfare must be economy unless pre-approved by Finance.

hr-1.chunk: New hires must complete I-9 within three business days.

fin-3.chunk: Hotel stays are reimbursable up to $180/night in Tier-1 cities and $130/night elsewhere; taxes and mandatory fees are included in the cap.

fin-4.chunk: Ground transportation should favor public transit and rideshare pool options when safe and practical.

fin-5.chunk: Personal car mileage is reimbursed at the IRS standard rate; parking and tolls require itemized receipts.

fin-6.chunk: Per-diem covers meals and incidentals only; alcohol is not reimbursable under any circumstances.

fin-7.chunk: International travel must be booked at least 14 days in advance unless approved by the CFO.

fin-8.chunk: Conference registration fees are reimbursable when pre-approved and directly related to the employee’s role.

fin-9.chunk: All corporate card transactions must be expensed within 15 calendar days of the statement close.

fin-10.chunk: Spend over $5,000 requires a purchase order and vendor onboarding through Procurement.

fin-11.chunk: Three competitive quotes are required for purchases between $10,000 and $50,000 unless a sole-source justification is approved.

fin-12.chunk: Subscription software must be tied to an owner and a cost center; auto-renewals should be reviewed 30 days prior.

fin-13.chunk: Expense reports missing receipts over $25 will be returned; repeated violations may result in card suspension.

fin-14.chunk: Grants and customer-funded travel must bill actuals to the project code provided by FP&A.

fin-15.chunk: Stipends for remote work equipment are capped at $400/year and must be purchased through approved vendors.

fin-16.chunk: Currency conversion fees on corporate cards are reimbursable; personal card conversions are not.

fin-17.chunk: Airfare changes after ticketing require Finance approval unless due to airline-initiated changes.

fin-18.chunk: Team meals require a business purpose and attendee list; tips should not exceed 20% before tax.

fin-19.chunk: Capital purchases (useful life > 1 year) must be coded to the fixed asset account and tagged for inventory.

fin-20.chunk: Employees must use the preferred travel agency for booking to enable duty-of-care and negotiated rates.

eng-1.chunk: All production deploys require an approved change ticket linked to the relevant issue and a rollback plan.

eng-2.chunk: Services must expose a /healthz endpoint that returns 200 OK when dependencies are healthy.

eng-3.chunk: Critical alerts page on-call within 2 minutes and must have actionable runbook steps.

eng-4.chunk: Every microservice must publish an OpenAPI spec to the internal registry and keep it versioned.

eng-5.chunk: Pull requests require at least one approving review and all required checks passing; self-merges are disallowed.

eng-6.chunk: Secrets must be stored in the centralized vault; environment variables should reference secret paths, not plaintext.

eng-7.chunk: Datastores must define RPO ≤ 24h and RTO ≤ 4h, with quarterly restore tests documented.

eng-8.chunk: Breaking API changes require a deprecation notice and a minimum 2 minor releases of overlap.

eng-9.chunk: Production data may not be copied to developer laptops; use masked datasets or synthetic fixtures.

eng-10.chunk: Infrastructure changes must be represented as code and peer-reviewed before apply.

eng-11.chunk: Services must emit structured logs in JSON with request IDs and user IDs when available.

eng-12.chunk: SLOs: target availability ≥ 99.9% for external APIs; error budgets are reviewed in postmortems.

eng-13.chunk: All containers must run as non-root and have a read-only root filesystem unless justified.

eng-14.chunk: Dependencies must be scanned for known CVEs weekly; high severity issues fixed within 7 days.

eng-15.chunk: Feature flags must default to safe values and be auto-removed within two releases.

eng-16.chunk: Schema migrations must be backwards compatible for at least one deployment cycle.

eng-17.chunk: PII fields must be tagged in the schema and encrypted at rest; access is logged and reviewed monthly.

eng-18.chunk: Incident severity is determined by customer impact and SLA breach risk; SEV-1 requires exec comms within 30 min.

hr-2.chunk: Employees accrue 1.5 vacation days per month; balances carry over up to 10 days into the next year.

hr-3.chunk: New hires must complete security and code-of-conduct training within 14 days of start.

hr-4.chunk: Remote work arrangements require manager approval and must comply with local labor laws.

hr-5.chunk: Performance reviews occur biannually; calibration sessions are facilitated by HRBPs.

hr-6.chunk: Expense reimbursements are paid on the next payroll after approval and audit.

hr-7.chunk: Company holidays are published annually; essential operations may require coverage with premium pay.

hr-8.chunk: Parental leave provides 12 weeks paid for birthing parents and 8 weeks paid for non-birthing parents.

hr-9.chunk: Internal job postings are visible for at least 5 business days before external posting.

hr-10.chunk: Offer letters must use the standard template and be approved by Compensation for band alignment.

hr-11.chunk: All contractors require a signed MSA and a statement of work with clear deliverables and term.

hr-12.chunk: Workplace concerns can be reported confidentially via the ethics hotline; retaliation is prohibited.

hr-13.chunk: Annual harassment prevention training is mandatory for all people managers.

hr-14.chunk: Equity grants are subject to board approval and follow the company’s standard vesting schedule.

hr-15.chunk: Sick leave is separate from vacation and should be used for personal or family health needs.

hr-16.chunk: Exit interviews are scheduled during the notice period and insights are anonymized quarterly.

hr-17.chunk: Badge access is terminated at end of employment date; equipment must be returned within 5 business days.

hr-18.chunk: Reasonable accommodations are available through HR upon request with supporting documentation.
